data.meta_site_name: Peter Jackson's The Lord of the Rings Trilogy Wiki
data.text:
Billy Jackson (born 1995) is a New Zealand actor who portrayed Minto Boffin in The Fellowship of the Ring, a Cute Rohan Refugee Child in The Two Towers, and a "Featured Child" at Minas Tirith and in Sam and Rosie's wedding in The Return of the King.

Filmography[]

Film[]

The Frighteners (1996) - Baby in Bouncer

The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring (2001) - Minto Boffin (credited as "Cute Hobbit Child")

The Lord of the Rings: The Two Towers (2002) - Cute Rohan Refugee Child

The Lord of the Rings: the Return of the King (2003) - Featured Child

King Kong (2005) - NY Child

The Lovely Bones (2009) - Mall Shopper

The Hobbit: The Battle of the Five Armies (2014) - Laketown Refugee (uncredited)

Behind the scenes[]

Billy is the son and oldest child of Peter Jackson and Fran Walsh and the oldest brother of Katie Jackson. He has made a cameo appearance in every of his father's films (except the first two films of The Hobbit trilogy) since The Frighteners.

Billy did not wear a wig when he filmed his first Lord of the Rings cameo, and was the third extra in the trilogy after Matt Appleton and Dan Hennah not to wear a wig.
